descbody.para: Special notes on the preparation and bonding operations for windows
For cutting operations window detachment : description GIEMR-000835.

entry.para: e.g. "removal - refitting" and/or replacement of windows
e.g. replacement of the roof, windscreen frame
e.g. bare body supplied painted, cataphoretic steel tailgate, primed plastic tailgate

descbody.para: Carefully clean the bonding area using heptane vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products) avoiding the cement bead.
Wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Grind the residual beading (leave 1 to 2 mm thickness of cement bead).

noteR.para: In the case of paint damage larger than1 mm, apply a layer of primer (green and red marking) with a single, uniform stroke over the entire damaged area.

descbody.para: Leave to dry for at least 10 minutes.
Apply the primer with a single, uniform stroke onto the entire bonding area (residual/lacquer beading).
Leave to dry for at least 10 minutes.
Prepare the window (see procedure 4 or 5).
Apply the cement bead (preferably onto the window).
Bond the window immediately.

description.title: procedure 2: on repaired and/or replaced bodywork component

descbody.para: Carefully clean the bonding area using heptane vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products) avoiding the cement bead.
Wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Before applying the paint range, protect the bonding area with masking tape.
Remove the masking tape.
Clean the bonding area carefully with heptane vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Grind the residual beading (leave 1 to 2 mm thickness of cement bead).
Apply the primer with two uniform strokes over the entire bonding area, waiting at least 10 minutes between strokes.
Leave to dry for at least 10 minutes.

noteR.para: Apply the primer 1 hour after curing and cooling of the component is complete.

descbody.para: Prepare the window (see procedure 4 or 5).
Apply the cement bead (preferably onto the window).
Bond the window immediately.

description.title: procedure 3: on new bodywork component (Parts Department)

descbody.para: Sand lightly using a grey pad vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Clean the bonding area carefully with heptane vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Before applying the paint range, protect the bonding area with masking tape.
Wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Remove the masking tape.
Clean the bonding area carefully with heptane vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Apply the primer over the entire bonding area.

noteR.para: Apply the primer 1 hour after curing and cooling of the component is complete.

descbody.para: Leave to dry for at least 10 minutes.
Prepare the window (see procedure 4 or 5).
Apply the cement bead (preferably onto the window).
Bond the window immediately.

description.title: procedure 4: on a new window (Parts Department)

descbody.para: Ensure you have the correct window.
Check that there are no faults or cracks.
Clean the bonding area carefully with heptane vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Fit the trims (according to the vehicle).
Carry out a test assembly for the vehicle window.
Apply the glass cleaner/activator with a pre-soaked wipe.
Clean immediately with the dry wipe.
Apply the primer with a single, uniform stroke around the outside edge of the window, along the bonding line.
Leave to dry for at least 10 minutes.
Apply the cement bead.
Bond the window immediately.

descsection.para: Ensure you have the correct window.
Check that there are no faults or cracks.
Carry out a test assembly for the vehicle window.

Clean the bonding area carefully using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products) and active solvent degreaser (by HENKEL with part number TEROSTAT 8545 OT - 25 ).
Wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Apply the cement bead (by SIKA and with part number SIKAFLEX - 222 UV ).

description.title: procedure 6: on removed window (With residual beading)

descbody.para: Check that there are no faults or cracks.
Carefully clean the bonding area using heptane vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products) avoiding the cement bead.
Wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Grind the residual beading (leave 1 to 2 mm thickness of cement bead).
Fit the trims (according to the vehicle).
Carry out a test assembly for the vehicle window.

noteR.para: If there is an area with no residual beading on the window (for example: difficulty in adhering):

ul.li: apply the glass cleaner/activator using a pre-soaked wipe along the bonding line,

descbody.para: Apply the primer (green and red marking) with a single, uniform stroke over the entire bonding area.
Leave to dry for at least 10 minutes.
Apply the cement bead.
Bond the window immediately.

description.title: procedure 7: on removed polycarbonate window (with residual beading)

descbody.para: Check that there are no faults or cracks.
Carefully clean the bonding area with water.
Wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Grind the residual beading (leave 1 to 2 mm thickness of cement bead).
Carry out a test assembly for the vehicle window.

noteR.para: If there is an area with no residual beading on the window (for example: difficulty in adhering):

ul.li: apply the active solvent degreaser (by HENKEL with part number TEROSTAT 8545 OT - 25 ) using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products),
wipe the bonding area using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).

descbody.para: Apply the active solvent degreaser (by HENKEL with part number TEROSTAT 8545 OT - 25 ) using a lint-free cloth vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 (04B, Consumables - Products).
Apply the cement bead (by SIKA and with part number SIKAFLEX - 222 UV ).
Bond the window immediately.

description.title: procedure 7: on removed polycarbonate window (with residual beading)

descsection.para: Refit the windscreen starting from the top.
Keep the windscreen in position using a dual suction cup between the windshield and the roof.
Once the windshield is in place, manually position the windshield near the windshield aperture lower cross member.
